tech_news.title: Apple’s cheapest iPad is already $70 off for Black Friday - The Verge
tech_news.description: Apple’s 11th-gen iPad is down to a record low price of $279 ($70 off) for Black Friday. The latest iPad Pro and iPad Air are also on sale.

tech_news.title: The Analogue 3D will be available again next week, but with a $20 price bump - The Verge
tech_news.description: ﻿The company is blaming tariffs for the price increase from $249.99 to $269.99.

tech_news.title: AI agents are invading your PC - The Verge
tech_news.description: Microsoft is making a big push to put agentic AI everywhere in your computer, plus our thoughts on Meta’s big win in court and the latest from Brendan Carr’s FCC.

tech_news.title: PlayStation's 2025 Black Friday Sale is Live: $100 Off PS5 Consoles, 33% Off PS Plus, and More - IGN
tech_news.description: PlayStation's official Black Friday 2025 sale is now live across all retailers. From Nov. 21 to Dec. 1, you can save $100 off PS5 consoles, $20 off DualSense Controllers, 33% off PS Plus, and more.

tech_news.title: What is A Chunky Knit Doing in Wicked’s Sexiest Scene? - The Cut
tech_news.description: There is exactly one sexy scene in ‘Wicked: For Good,’ and ‘As Long As You’re Mine’ is nearly derailed by Elphaba donning an enormous wool cardigan.

tech_news.title: AirDropping stuff from a Pixel phone rules so much - The Verge
tech_news.description: Google recently announced AirDrop interoperability for Pixel 10 phones, and it really works. Let’s hope Apple doesn’t shut it down.

tech_news.title: Xbox Finally Fixes An Annoying Part About Console-Specific Livestreams - GameSpot
tech_news.description: It's a small, but very welcome, addition to the standard showcase format.

tech_news.title: Silent Hill 2's brilliant remake is now on Xbox worldwide with 50% off, and its upcoming movie adaptation has a new trailer too - Eurogamer
tech_news.description: Last year's stupendous Silent Hill 2 remake is finally available on Xbox Series X/S worldwide, and the upcoming movie adaptation has a new trailer.

tech_news.title: Stoke Space goes for broke to solve the only launch problem that “moves the needle” - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: “Does the world really need a 151st rocket company?”…
